intro: Thesium repandum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants with showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Thesium repandum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
